Description: Fragment of East Greek small, deep pottery bowl; glazed on the interior, fired red (2.5 YR 5/6-10 R 5/6); on the slipped exterior, the remains of a lotus above two black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 28, no. 98 pl. 27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.122)
